intro: Rosa trachyphylla f. kuhbergensis, commonly known as the Kuhberg rose, is a hybrid form of the rough玫瑰 (Rosa trachyphylla). It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers with a subtle scent. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. This variety is relatively hardy and can thrive in a range of soil types, making it a versatile addition to gardens.
